data.title: [Terrain] Choosing the collider detail level in terrain colliders.
data.body:
This request came from this topic: http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic758.html and the IRC discussion that came with it.

When using a detailed enough terrain (513x513 heightmap in my case) and big colliders: Something like the collider being 1:50 to the terrain, not that big. Bullet has to process a lot of collisions making even the most simple scenes unplayable with modern hardware. I solved the issue by using an invisible terrain on top of the detailed one with a smaller 65x65 texture, but this is nothing more than a workaround for what I think it's a missing feature in terrain CollisionShape.

You can check my post on the forum for a detailed description on the issue and even a video of it.

I think there should be a way to choose the detail level of a terrain collider based on the mipmaps of the heightmap image. So basically the collider could be defined by a lower detail version of the terrain shape to avoid performance issues.

data.title: Multiple viewports for Drawable2D's
data.body:
Renderer2D performs batching optimization for Drawable2D's, meaning that it needs to know upfront (in the UpdateBatches phase) how many drawables there are and what batches they will end up forming.

However, batch update happens long before rendering. Before rendering, it also needs to update the  vertex & index buffers with vertices from the visible drawables.

To allow multiple views properly, Renderer2D needs to keep knowledge of each view's drawables and batches so that it can keep the two update phases (UpdateBatches and UpdateGeometry) in sync and draw multiple views correctly in the same frame.

data.title: Enable precompiled header for GCC and Clang
data.body: Currently the `enable_pch()` macro does not actually handle the precompiled header for GCC and Clang correctly.

data.title: Drawable2D visibility check
data.body:
I'd like to check visibility of 2D drawables (AnimatedSprite2D and StaticSprite2D) to limit the udpate calls when drawables are not visible.
As Drawable2D derives from Drawable, IsInView() should work for 2D either, but it always returns false (I've tried in C++, AS and lua).
Renderer2D class has a CheckVisibility() method and Drawable2D has a visibility_ variable that is not used.

data.title: [Editor] (feature request) tag filter for hierarchy window
data.body:
I think that this feature helps a lot with navigation on hierarchy list more fast. I made a simple example image of that. Of how it may looks.
when you select "all" - in hierarchy list shows all nodes
when you select other tag in hierarchy list show nodes (with his childs) only have that tag in node vars.

and when nodes create by user in editor or when SomeScene.xml loads to editor the hierarchy window looks to "tag" variable of each scene node and if it present, the hierarchy window made an new tag group (if not yet exist) or store ID of node in alredy existed tagset. This tagsets then used for list menu in head of hierarchy window.

data.title: Using TileMap2D::PositionToTileIndex()
data.body:
I've modified line 97 of TileMapDefs2D.cpp to get accurate result from TileMap2D::PositionToTileIndex():

``` c++
            y = (x_add_y - x_sub_y) / 2;
```

(may also need rounding)

Now, PositionToTileIndex() returns a boolean, so how can I access x and y using this function in script (AngelScript and lua)?

data.title: Last commit in Allocator.h makes LogicComponent.h not able to find Urho3D.h
data.body:
The title should say it all. Today the line
# include "../Urho3D.h"

Has been removed brom Allocator.h, commit message was: "Avoid the include dirs hack for finding the Urho3D.h header."

It seems that Urho3D.h is now not reachable through includes from LogicComponent.h and thus the macro URHO3D_API is not defined. 

Adding #include <Urho3D/Urho3D.h> before including LogicComponent.h solves the issue

data.title: Lua: console.GetCommandInterpreter() would raise error.
(feature request) Option to build both shared and static with samples dynamically linked.
data.body:
Proposal, a default value for URHO3D_LIB_TYPE set to SHARED, other options are STATIC or BOTH. When chosing BOTH, the project acts as if SHARED, but the make still spits out the static lib too. (samples are dynamically linked, but libUrho3D.a is still generated)
Very convenient to have support for both types of linking on the same system and in the same build.

Now, if I want both I'll build Urho3D twice with SHARED last so the dynamically linked and significantly smaller binaries overwrite the previous ~1.7G of sample binaries.

data.title: GraphicsDefs.h needs URHO3D_API for external symbols.
data.body:
Since -fvisibility=hidden is in effect, all the StringHash symbols requires explicit visibility.

EDIT: adding **attribute**((visibility("default"))) did not help for me. I'm not sure why symbols are still hidden.

EDIT2 and patching:
1. Put URHO3D_API for every extern you want public.
2. #include "GraphicsDefs.h"  was missing from GraphicsDefs.cpp, it must be added or the symbols won't be properly declared at object build time.

data.title: Install destinations on Linux.
data.body:
Previous to this morning everything installed in /usr/local/share/Urho3D, except the libs that were put in /usr/local/lib64. Now, it isn't completely correct to put everything under share, but whatever, at least it's contained.

This morning I find that the demo binaries, tool binaries and scripts go under /usr/local/bin, that is correct and good. As is putting headers under /usr/local/include. What is not good is that Data and Core data is also put under /usr/local/bin.

Ideally, it would look something like:
$PREFIX/bin <- binaries, not data
$PREFIX/include <- headers
$PREFIX/lib (or lib64) <- both shared and static libs
$PREFIX/share <- data. put Data and DataCore here along with docs and what not

data.title: Tiled property issue on Android
data.body:
When creating a property for a 'Polygon' or 'Poly Line' Object in Tiled, the tmx resource file becomes 'unreadable' on Android.

Steps to reproduce:

```
open isometric_grass_and_water.tmx in Tiled
create an 'Object' layer
create a 'Polygon' or 'Poly Line' Object
create a property for this Object
save tmx file
run sample 36_Urho2DTileMap on Android
```

Note: works OK with 'Rectangle' and 'Ellipse' properties.

data.title: Segfault when removing an AnimatedSprite2D that has been cloned
Cloning an AnimatedSprite2D issue on Android
Rename the "Bin" subdir to "bin" (small letter case). Install/package the binaries to /usr/local/bin instead of /usr/local/share/Urho3D/Bin
data.body:
These are the last few left in my TODO list for the new build system.
- The small letter case "bin" is more consistent with the "lib" output directory in the new build system.
- We should have installed our binaries to the "/usr/local/bin" since the beginning.

Question: Where should we install/package the bundle apps for the OSX and iOS to? At the moment I plan to just leave them in the share/Urho3D/bin.

data.title: ResourcePrefixPath requires trailing slash.
Provide Lua bindings for ResourceCache.resourceDirs
data.body: Currently, ResourceCache::GetResourceDirs() is not accessible via Lua, making it so there is no good way for accessing the user-provided resource locations.
